alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Gibson; Obion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 1:26PM CST until January 12 at 9:36PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee... Obion River near Obion For the Obion River...including Martin, Obion, Bogota...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Obion River near Obion. * WHEN...From Monday evening to late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Several secondary roads and large areas of farmland are flooded in northern Dyer County. Flooding is occurring around Rives in southeast Obion County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 32.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 33.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 33.3 feet and begin rising again tomorrow morning. It will rise above flood stage tomorrow evening and continue to rise to 35.0 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.1 feet on 05/19/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
